improvement_patterns: Defined precise data points to be extracted for each news article, ensuring structured and comprehensive output.
Added a clear problem statement to define the core objective.
Specified the game genre (Fixed-shooter or top-down maze) and theme (Sci-fi or maze exploration) to remove ambiguity.
Detailed core gameplay mechanics including player movement, enemy AI, collision detection, scoring, and game over conditions.
Clarified the interpretation of 'open world' in a 2D retro context (interconnected screens/areas, not a single screen or massive procedural generation).
Adjusted the game genre from 'fixed-shooter' to 'top-down action-adventure/exploration' for better compatibility with an open-world concept.
Introduced specific requirements for 'Camera/View Management' (smooth scrolling or screen-by-screen transitions).
Added a clear problem statement defining the core objective.

Specified technical requirements including platform (Web, HTML5 Canvas, JS), core mechanics (movement, collision, enemies, blocks), game elements (tiles, sprites, collectibles, power-ups), UI, and architectural patterns.
Defined expected deliverables (playable app, source code, assets, design document) and their format.
Transformed a vague request into a structured and highly specific game design prompt.
Defined a clear genre (FPS) and sub-genre elements (tactical, crafting, exploration).
Established a detailed post-apocalyptic sci-fi setting and theme.
